subtitle: chapter xxxii rama is raised from the
dead now a certain man was sick named
Lazarus when Jesus heard that he said
this sickness is not unto death but for
the glory of God then the son of God
might be glorified thereby Sri Yukteswar
was expounding the Christian scriptures
one sunny morning on the balcony of his
Serampore Hermitage besides a few of
masters other disciples I was present
with a small group of my ranty students
in this passage Jesus calls himself the
son of God though he was truly United
with God his reference here was a deep
impersonal significance my guru
explained the Son of God is the Christ
or divine consciousness and man no
mortal can glorify God the only honor
that man can pay his creator is to seek
Him man cannot glorify an abstraction as
he's not known the glory or Nimbus
around the head of the Saints is a
symbolic witness of their capacity to
render divine homage Sri Yukteswar went
on to read the marvelous story of
Lazarus resurrection at its conclusion
master fell into a long silence the
sacred book opened on his knee I too was
privileged to behold a similar miracle
my guru finally spoke with solemn
unction Larry Moss has resurrected one
of my friends from the dead the young
lads at my side smiled with keen
interest there was enough of a boy in me
too to enjoy not only the philosophy but
in particular any story I could get Sri
Yukteswar to relate about his wondrous
experience with his guru my friend Rahm
and I were inseparable Master began
because he was shy and reclusive he
chose to visit our guru Larry Masha only
during the hours of midnight and dawn
when the crowd of daytime disciples
absence as Rama's closest friend I
served the spiritual vent to which he
let out the wealth of his spiritual
perceptions I found inspiration as ideal
companionship my gurus face soffit with
memories Rama was suddenly put to a
severe test Sri Yukteswar continued he
contracted the disease of Asiatic
cholera as our master never objected to
the services of physicians at time of
serious illness
two specialists were summoned amidst the
frantic rush of ministry into the
stricken man I was deeply praying to
Larry masa for help I hurried to his
home and sobbed off the story
the doctors are seen Rama he will be
well my guru smiled jogging Lee I
returned with a light heart to my
friend's bedside only to find him in a
dying state he could not last more than
one or two hours one of the physicians
told me with a gesture of despair once
more i hastened to larry masha
the doctors are conscientious men I am
sure Rama will be well the master
dismissed me blithely at Rama's place I
found both doctors gone one had left a
note we have done our best but his case
is hopeless
my friend was indeed the picture of a
dying man I did not understand how Larry
Marcia's words could fail to come true
yet the sight of rama's rapidly ebbing
life kept suggesting to my mind all is
over now tossing thus on the Seas of
faith and apprehensive doubt i
ministered to my friend as best I could
he roused himself to cry out yukteshwar
run to master and tell him I am gone ask
him to bless my body before its last
rites with these words Rama sighed
heavily and gave up the ghost I wet for
an hour by his beloved form always a
lover of quiet now he had attained the
utter stillness of death another
disciple came in I asked him to remain
in house until I returned half dazed I
trudged back to my guru how was Rama now
Larry Marcia's faith with Reason smiles
sir you will soon see how he is I've
littered out emotionally in a few hours
you will see his body before it is
carried to the crematoria grounds I
broke down and moan awfully yukteshwar
control yourself sit calmly and meditate
my guru retired into samadhi the
afternoon a night passed and unbroken
silence I struggled unsuccessfully to
regain an inner composure at Don Larry
Masha glanced at me consolingly I see
you are still disturbed why didn't you
explain yourself yesterday that you
expected me to give Rama tangible aid in
the form of some medicine
the master pointed to a cup shaped lamp
containing crude castor oil fill a
little bottle from the lamp put seven
drops into Rama's mouth sir I
remonstrated he has been dead since
yesterday afternoon of what uses the oil
now never mind just do as I asked Larry
Marcia's cheerful mood was
incomprehensible I was still an honest
wedge agony of bereavement pouring out a
small amount of oil I departed from
Rama's house I found my friend's body
rigid in the death collapse
paying no attention to his ghastly
condition I opened his lips with my
right finger and managed with my left
hand in the help of the cork to put the
oil drop by drop over his clenched teeth
as a seventh draw touched his cold lips
Rama shivered violently his muscles
vibrated from head to foot as he sat up
wonderfully I saw Larry Masha in a blaze
of light he cried he shone like the Sun
arise forsake your sleep he commanded me
come with you cure Schwar to see me I
could scarcely believe my eyes when Rama
dressed himself and was strong enough
after that fatal sickness to walk to the
home of our guru there he prostrated
himself before Larry Marcia with tears
of gratitude the master was beside
himself with mirth his eyes twinkle at
me mischievously yukteshwar he said
surely henceforth you will not fail to
carry with you a bottle of castor oil
whenever you see a corpse just
administer the oil why seven drops of
lamp oil must surely foil the power of
Yama guru ji you'll ridicule me I don't
understand please point out the nature
of my error I told you twice that Rama
would be well yet you could not fully
believe me Larry Masha explained I did
that mean that doctors would be able
Kyurem I remarked only that they were in
attendance there was no causal
connection between my two statements I
didn't want to interfere with physicians
they have to live too in a voice we're
sounding with joy my guru added always
know that the inexhaustible paramount
them can heal any one doctor or no
doctor I see my mistake I acknowledge
remorsefully I now know that your simple
word is binding on the whole cosmos as
Sri Yukteswar finished the awesome story
one of the spellbound listeners ventured
a question that from a child was doubly
understandable sir he said why did your
guru use Castrol child giving the oil
had no meaning except that I expected
something material and learning master
chose the nearby oil as an objective
symbol for awakening in my greater faith
the master allowed Rama to die because I
had partially doubted but to divine guru
knew that in as much as he had said the
disciple would be well the healing must
take place even though he had to cure
Rama of death a disease usually final
Sri Yukteswar dismissed the little group
and motioned me to a blanket seat at his
feet Yogananda he said with unusual
gravity you have been surrounded from
birth by the direct disciples of Larry
Masha the great master lived his sublime
life and partial seclusion and
steadfastly refused to permit his
followers to build any organization
around his teaching he made nevertheless
a significant prediction about fifty
years after my passing he said my life
will be written because of a deep
interest in yoga which the West will
manifest the yogic message will encircle
the globe and aid in establishing that
brotherhood of man which results from
direct perception of the one father my
son yoga Nanda Sri Yukteswar went on you
must do your part in spreading that
message and in writing that sacred life
fifty years later after Larry Moss was
passing in 1895 culminated in 1945
year of completion this present book I
cannot but be struck by the countenance
of the year 1945 has also ushered in a
new age the era of revolutionary atomic
energies all thoughtful Minds turn is
never before to the urgent problems of
peace and brotherhood lest the continued
use of physical force banish all men
along with the problems though the human
race and its works disappeared traces
lee by time or bomb the Sun does not
falter in its course the stars keep them
invariable vigil cosmic law cannot be
stayed or changed and man would do well
to put himself in harmony with it if the
cosmos is against might if the Sun wars
not with the planets but retires a do
full time to give the stars their little
sway what avails our mailed fist shall
any peace indeed come out of it not
cruelty but goodwill arms the universal
sinews a humanity at peace will know of
the endless fruits of victory sweeter to
the taste than any nurtured of the soil
of blood The effect of League of Nations
will be a natural nameless League of
human heart the broad sympathies in
discern an insight needed for the
healing of earthly wolves cannot flow
from a mere intellectual consideration
of man's diversity but from knowledge of
man's soul unity its kinship of God
toward realization of the world's
highest ideal peace through brotherhood
may yoga the science of personal contact
with divine spreading time to all men in
all lands though India's civilization is
ancient above any other few historians
have noted that her feet of national
survival is by no means an accident but
a logical incident in the devotion to
eternal verities which India has offered
through her best men in every generation
by sheer continuity of being by in
transitivity before the ages can dust
scholars truly tell us how many India
has given the word is answer of any
people to the challenge of time
the biblical story of abraham's plead
the lord to the city of sodom be spared
if ten righteous men can be found
therein and the divine reply i will not
destroy it for 10s sake gains new
meaning in the light of india's escape
from the oblivion of Babylon Egypt and
other mighty nations who were once her
contemporaries the Lord's answer clearly
shows that a land lives not by its
material achievements but in its
masterpieces of man let the divine words
be heard again in this 20th century
twice dyed in blood are half over
no nation that can produce ten men great
in the eyes of the unbreathable judge
shall no extinction heating such
persuasion India has proved herself not
witless against the thousands cunning of
time self-realized masters in every
century of Hallowed or soil modern
christ-like sages like Larry Masha and
his disciple Sri Yukteswar raised up to
proclaim with the science of yoga is
more vital than any material advantage
to man's happiness and to a nation's
longevity very scanty information about
the life of Larry Masha and his
universal doctrine has ever appeared in
print for three decades in India America
and Europe I have found a deep and
sincere interest in his message of
liberating yoga a written account of the
Masters life even as he foretold is now
needed in the West where lives of the
great modern Yogi's are little known
nothing but one or two small pamphlets
in English has been written on the
Guru's life one biography in Bengali
Sri Sri schwa ma Charla hari Masha
appeared in 1941 it was written by my
disciple
Swami Sachin anda who for many years has
been the Acharya spiritual preceptor of
ravaghi ala in Ranchi I have translated
a few passages from his book and have
incorporated them into this section
devoted to Larry Masha it was into a
pious Brahmin family of ancient lineage
that Larry Masha was born September
xxx 1828 his birthplace was a village of
gurnie in the Naga district near
krishana bengal he was the youngest son
of mogh takashi the second wife of the
esteem gar Mahan Lahiri his first wife
after the birth of three sons had died
during a pilgrimage the boy's mother
passed away during his childhood little
about her is known except the revealing
fact that she was an ardent devotee of
Lord Shiva spiritually designated as the
king of Yogi's the boy Lahari was given
name as Shama Charen spent his early
years in the ancestral home at nadia at
the age of three or four he was often
observed sitting under the sand and a
posture of a yogi his body completely
hidden except for the head the Lahiri
estate was destroyed in a winter of 1833
when the nearby delink Irie ver changed
its course and disappeared into the
depths of the Ganges one of the Shiva
temples founded by the hearings went
into the river along with the family
home a devotee rescued a stone image of
Lord Shiva from the swirling waters and
placed it in a new temple now well known
as the Gurney Shiva side Gower
Mahon Lahiri and his family left Nady
and became residents of Banaras where
the father immediately erected a shiva
temple he conducted his household along
the lines of Vedic discipline with
regular observance of ceremonial worship
acts of charity and scriptural study
just an open-minded however he did not
ignore the beneficent current of modern
ideas the boy Lahiri took lessons in
Hindi in Urdu and Banaras study groups
he attended a school conducted by joy
nari and ghoshal receiving instruction
in sanskrit bengali french and english
applying himself to a close study of the
vedas the young yogi listened eagerly to
scriptural discussion by learned
Brahmins including a Muraki pundit named
Naga bata
Shyama Sharn was a kind gentle and
courteous young beloved buys all
companions with a well proportioned
bright and powerful body he excelled in
swimming and in many skillful activities
Shyama chart Lahiri was married to
Srimati kashi mony daughter of sri
dubbin aron Sanyal a model indian
housewife kashi mone cheerfully carried
on her home duties and the traditional
householders obligation to serve guests
than the poor two saintly sons din curry
and do curry blessed the union at the
age of 23 and 1851 larry masha took the
post of accountant in the military
engineering department of the english
government he received many promotions
during a time of his service thus not
only was he a master before God's eyes
but also success and the little human
drama where he played his given role as
an office worker in the world as the
officers of the army department was
shifted laterally masa was transferred
to gossip or merger poor Donna poor
nanny tall Banaras and other localities
after the death of his father
Lahiri had to assume the entire
responsibility of his family for whom he
bought a quiet residence in the garage -
wha Mahalo neighbourhood of Banaras it
was in his 33rd year the lira Masha saw
fulfillment of the purpose for which he
had been reincarnated on earth the ash
hidden flame long smouldering received
its opportunity to burst into flame a
divine decree resting beyond the gaze of
human beings works mysteriously to bring
all things into outer manifestation to
proper time he met his great guru Baba
ji near Rana ket and was initiated by
him into Kriya yoga this auspicious
event did not happen him alone it was a
fortunate moment for all the human race
many of whom were later privileged to
receive the soul awakening gift of Kriya
the lost or long-vanished highest art of
yoga was again being brought to light
many spiritually thirsty men and women
eventually found their way to the cool
waters of Kriya yoga just as in the
Hindu legend where mother Ganges offers
her divine drought to the parched
devotee Bhagirath so the celestial flood
of kriya rolled from the secret fastness
of the himalayas into the dusty haunts
of men end of chapter
